#Text=Handle a New Dog
#Text=Getting a new dog can be exciting and a life changing experience .
#Text=In fact , you may grow to become best friends with your dog !
#Text=Although , getting a new dog can be frustrating and stressful .
#Text=Here 's how to handle it .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Feeding your dog can be extrememly difficult !
#Text=When you have a dog , food matters a lot .
#Text=A dog with food is a happy dog !
#Text=Add different meat to the food if your dog is picky . ( Make sure the added food is healthy . ) You can get canned dog food at stores that is high in protein and nutrition .
#Text=Get the right type of kibble for your dog .
#Text=Kibble depends on breed , age , and size .
#Text=Lots of people think that dogs do n't to bath that much because they 'll just get dirty again , but bathing your dog is highly important .
#Text=Get flea bath shampoo that rids your dog 's fur of ticks and fleas .
#Text=Check the ingredients and the prices .
#Text=Be gentle when bathing your dog .
#Text=If you notice that your dog 's skin is flaking or dry , go to a vet near you .
#Text=Your pet 's doctor should give you some advice or special shampoo that will help your dog 's skin .
#Text=Let your dog out as often as possible ! Exercise and pottying is important for you dog at all times .
#Text=Tell your dog a certain word everytime they use the bathroom .
#Text=For instance : " Go potty " or " Drop a duse " .
#Text=They will get used to the certain word and potty on command .
#Text=Do n't let your dog in until they poop/pee .
#Text=Use training pads if peeing/pooping in house continues .
#Text=Keep moving it closer to your door and finally outside .
#Text=Your dog will start to get use to pottying outside .
#Text=If you have to work away from home , always let your dog out as soon as you get home .
#Text=Let your dog get 1-4 hours of running outside per day .
#Text=We all know that we need our naps .
#Text=If we do n't get them , there will be issues !
#Text=It 's the same thing for dogs !
#Text=Have a certain bed time . ( This may sound weird , but it helps your dog get lots of sleep . )
#Text=Use a certain word everytime you go to bed .
#Text=For instance : " Time for bed " or " TO BED NOW , YOU HEATHEN ! " . ( Just jokin ' ! ) Your dog will begin to go to his/her bed on command .

column1: #Text=Allow them to get used to sleeping on your bed or theirs .
#Text=Try not to get to irritated .
#Text=The more you yell at your dog , the more your relationship will drift apart .
#Text=If your dog gets out of control ( Jumping , clawing , biting , etc. ) , simply tell them to stop .
#Text=If nothing happens , ignore them and they will realise they are n't getting your attention .
#Text=Finally , walk away or keep your dog on a leash until they learn to stop .
#Text=When your dog poops or ruins your brand new purse ( Or anything else ) , keep calm .
#Text=Simply show them it and say " No " or " Bad " .
#Text=This will take some time , but will be worth it in the end .
#Text=If your dog escapes from your yard , remain calm .
#Text=Call their name a few times .
#Text=Do n't run after them .
#Text=This is a threat towards them .
#Text=Get a bit low to show that they have dominance ( But they do n't , you 're just tricking them ! ) and slowly approach them .
#Text=Say stuff like " Come here , buddy/girl .
